intro: Fracastora linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fracastora, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
